title: TREASURIES-U.S. yields hold rise after jobless, productivity data
text:
February 1, 2018 / 2:01 PM / Updated 27 minutes ago TREASURIES-U.S. yields hold rise after jobless, productivity data Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
NEW YORK, Feb 1 (Reuters) - U.S. Treasury yields held to their earlier rise on Thursday as an unexpected drop in weekly jobless claims and a surprise fall in worker productivity in the fourth quarter did little to alter tradersâ€™ view on domestic economic growth. 
At 8:53 a.m. (1353 GMT), benchmark 10-year Treasury yield was up 1.1 basis points at 2.731 percent. The 10-year yield reached a near four-year high at 2.754 percent on Wednesday, according to Reuters data. (Reporting by Richard Leong Editing by Chizu Nomiyama)
